name: Treefolk Harbinger
text: When Treefolk Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Treefolk or Forest card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

name: Treefolk Healer
text: {2}{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: Protected by druids for untold centuries, the forest began to return the favor.

name: Treefolk Mystic
text: Whenever Treefolk Mystic blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy all Auras attached to that creature.

editions.flavor: Urza's wards fell from him like autumn leaves as he entered the dreaming grove. He awoke imprisoned in living wood.

name: Treefolk Seedlings
text: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.

editions.flavor: The year that the brothers landed on Argoth, the trees produced five times as many seeds as normal.

Even the grandest forest begins with a single seedling.
—Llanowar saying

name: Tree Monkey
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: The vines and branches of the jungle canopy are all the wings it needs.

"They serve the world best on a platter with shallots and onions."
—Talas sailor

name: Tree of Perdition
text:
Defender
{T}: Exchange target opponent's life total with Tree of Perdition's toughness.

editions.flavor: There will be no absolution.

name: Tree of Redemption
text:
Defender
{T}: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption's toughness.

editions.flavor: The executioner's tree in Thraben Cathedral holds the power to absolve more than the souls of the hanged.

name: Tree of Tales
text:
(Tree of Tales isn't a spell.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Tel-Jilad, sanctum of the ancient trolls, keepers of the secret of Mirrodin's origin.
Tel-Jilad, sanctum of the ancient trolls, keepers of the secret of Mirrodin's origin.

name: Treespring Lorian
text: Morph {5}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: No matter your strength, the Krosan Forest is stronger. No matter your speed, the Wirewood Forest is faster.

name: Treetop Bracers
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: Gravity is truly what you make of it.
Gravity is truly what you make of it.
Gravity is truly what you make of it.

name: Treetop Defense
text:
Cast Treetop Defense only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Creatures you control gain reach until end of turn. (They can block creatures with flying.)

name: Treetop Rangers
text: Treetop Rangers can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

editions.flavor:
"If you can't catch them, cut the trees down from beneath them. Force them to fight on our terms."
—Mishra

name: Treetop Scout
text: Treetop Scout can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: At home among the swaying, supple branches of the treetops, some scouts live their entire lives never touching ground.

name: Treetop Sentinel
text: Flying, protection from green

editions.flavor: Crian's patrols afford him plenty of opportunity to take potshots at the "dirtwalkers" far below.

name: Treetop Village
text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis

name: Tremble
text: Each player sacrifices a land.

editions.flavor: Otaria's frequent tremors are the last stages of Dominaria's recovery from the Phyrexian war.

name: Tremor
text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

editions.flavor:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimag, Femeref philosopher
One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.
Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?

"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?
One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.
Without a word, Gerrard and Sisay ran deeper into the mountain. Neither of them intended to leave Mercadia without the Weatherlight and its crew.

name: Trench Gorger
text:
Trample
When Trench Gorger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for any number of land cards, exile them, then shuffle your library. If you do, Trench Gorger has base power and base toughness each equal to the number of cards exiled this way.

name: Trenching Steed
text: Sacrifice a land: Trenching Steed gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Keldons took several of the steeds as trophies of war. They'd never seen such a light beast stand so firm.

name: Trench Wurm
text: {2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.

editions.flavor:
"Their arrival marks the end of Yawgmoth's subtlety."
—Urza

name: Trepanation Blade
text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, defending player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card. The creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each card revealed this way. That player puts the revealed cards into his or her graveyard.
Equip {2}

name: Trespasser il-Vec
text: Discard a card: Trespasser il-Vec gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

editions.flavor: At the epicenter of the Rathi overlay, the City of Traitors did not align with Dominaria. Many of its inhabitants were caught between the two worlds.

name: Trespasser's Curse
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under enchanted player's control, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Even in the relative safety of the city, there are places best left undisturbed.

name: Trespassing Souleater
text: {U/P}: Trespassing Souleater can't be blocked this turn. ({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)

editions.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for surveilling our lives that we may be preserved from our own ignorance."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

name: Tresserhorn Sinks
text:
Tresserhorn Sinks enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Our land oppressed by silent Cold,
We weary wretches, young and old,
Pray that Springtime loose his hold."
—The Dynasty of Winter Kings

name: Tresserhorn Skyknight
text:
Flying
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Tresserhorn Skyknight by creatures with first strike.

editions.flavor: Kjeldorans who fled battle were exiled to the wastes. Those who strayed near Tresserhorn were pressed into service in Haakon's army.

name: Trestle Troll
text:
Defender
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{1}{B}{G}: Regenerate Trestle Troll.

editions.flavor: Unwelcome in Golgari colonies, he found his own dark place from which to represent the Swarm.

name: Treva's Attendant
text: {1}, Sacrifice Treva's Attendant: Add {G}{W}{U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Treva is the voice of the ur-dragon, demanding cries of worship."

name: Treva's Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Exile target attacking creature.
• Draw a card, then discard a card.

text:

name: Treva, the Renewer
text:
Flying
Whenever Treva, the Renewer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, choose a color, then you gain 1 life for each permanent of that color.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

name: Triad of Fates
text:
{1}, {T}: Put a fate counter on another target creature.
{W}, {T}: Exile target creature that has a fate counter on it, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
{B}, {T}: Exile target creature that has a fate counter on it. Its controller draws two cards.

name: Trial
text: Return all creatures blocking or blocked by target creature to their owner's hand.

name: Trial of Ambition
text:
When Trial of Ambition enters the battlefield, target opponent sacrifices a creature.
When a Cartouche enters the battlefield under your control, return Trial of Ambition to its owner's hand.

name: Trial of Knowledge
text:
When Trial of Knowledge enters the battlefield, draw three cards, then discard a card.
When a Cartouche enters the battlefield under your control, return Trial of Knowledge to its owner's hand.

name: Trial of Solidarity
text:
When Trial of Solidarity enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +2/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.
When a Cartouche enters the battlefield under your control, return Trial of Solidarity to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "You will succeed as one or fail as many."

name: Trial of Strength
text:
When Trial of Strength enters the battlefield, create a 4/2 green Beast creature token.
When a Cartouche enters the battlefield under your control, return Trial of Strength to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "Instincts to guide. Strength to overcome."

name: Trial of Zeal
text:
When Trial of Zeal enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
When a Cartouche enters the battlefield under your control, return Trial of Zeal to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "Eternal glory awaits you, my child."

name: Triangle of War
text: {2}, Sacrifice Triangle of War: Target creature you control fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.
The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.

name: Triassic Egg
text:
{3}, {T}: Put a hatchling counter on Triassic Egg.

• You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.

name: Tribal Flames

name: Tribal Golem
text: Tribal Golem has trample as long as you control a Beast, haste as long as you control a Goblin, first strike as long as you control a Soldier, flying as long as you control a Wizard, and "{B}: Regenerate Tribal Golem" as long as you control a Zombie.

name: Tribal Unity
text: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +X/+X until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Kamahl left the violence of his former life behind him, but he still believes in the power of muscle.
Kamahl left the violence of his former life behind him, but he still believes in the power of muscle.

name: Tribute to Hunger
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .

Counter target activated or triggered ability. If a permanent's ability is countered this way, activated abilities of that permanent can't be activated this turn. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

• Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

name: Tricks of the Trade
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: "Pathetic. You might as well have protected your treasures with a paper box and some string."

text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor: "If it ain't broke, I'll break it. If it is broke, I'll fix it."

text:
Flash

name: Trinisphere
text: As long as Trinisphere is untapped, each spell that would cost less than three mana to cast costs three mana to cast. (Additional mana in the cost may be paid with any color of mana or colorless mana. For example, a spell that would cost {1}{B} to cast costs {2}{B} to cast instead.)

editions.flavor:
"This exhibition of Nehra's Threshold Principle must be expropriated and examined for its potential applications in enforcement."
—Confiscation directive
Designed to restrain petty thoughts, but used to repress entire empires.

name: Trinket Mage
text: When Trinket Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Triplicate Spirits
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Create three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

name: Trip Noose
text: {2}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: A taut slipknot trigger is the only thing standing between you and standing.
A taut slipknot trigger is the only thing standing between you and standing.

name: Trip Wire
text: Destroy target creature with horsemanship.

editions.flavor: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

text:

text:
Flying
Triskelavus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelavus: Create a 1/1 colorless Triskelavite artifact creature token with flying. It has "Sacrifice this creature: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

name: Triskelion
text:
Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.

"Why do bad things always come in threes?"

A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion later proved both versatile and useful.

name: Triton Cavalry
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Triton Cavalry, you may return target enchantment to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The tritons broke the surface, and the Nyxborn broke ranks.

name: Triton Fortune Hunter
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Triton Fortune Hunter, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Thassa has blessed me with power and insight. I am careful not to disappoint her."

name: Triton Shorestalker
text: Triton Shorestalker can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: "Who will miss you, drywalker? A wife? A child? Perhaps they will blame the sea for your fate, and teach future generations to stay far away from it."

At sunrise, the Champion and her companions awoke to find their supplies gone and Brygus, their sentry, dead. Carefully arranged piles of ornamental shells gave a clear warning: go no further.
—The Theriad

name: Triton Tactics
text: Up to two target creatures each get +0/+3 until end of turn. Untap those creatures. At this turn's next end of combat, tap each creature that was blocked by one of those creatures this turn and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Triumph of Cruelty
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

editions.flavor:
"I've seen corpses prettier than you, beastmage."
—Liliana Vess

name: Triumph of Ferocity
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

editions.flavor:
"Rid me of this curse, witch, or die with me."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Triumph of the Hordes
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample and infect. (Creatures with infect deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor: Battle tempers soldiers as fire tempers steel.

name: Troll Ascetic
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.

editions.flavor: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.

text:
Enchant creature

name: Troll-Horn Cameo
text: {T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"I found a troll-horn fragment in the wooded foothills of Hurloon, and it keeps growing larger. I wonder, is the horn recreating itself or the troll?"
—Isel, master carver

name: Trolls of Tel-Jilad
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate target green creature.

editions.flavor: "The secret of this world weighs upon us, and we have been shaped by time and duty to bear it."

name: Tromokratis
text:
Tromokratis has hexproof unless it's attacking or blocking.
Tromokratis can't be blocked unless all creatures defending player controls block it. (If any creature that player controls doesn't block this creature, it can't be blocked.)

name: Tromp the Domains
text: Domain — Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.flavor: Ground into the footprints of the ravaging herd were clumps of salt from Benalia, moss from Llanowar, dust from Hurloon, and ash from as far as Urborg.

editions.flavor: "The tools of the past will help us forge the future."
